title: Chipotle Halloween deal: $4 Boorito returns along with a chance to win free food for a year
text:
CLOSE Starbucks will release a charcoal, vegan drink called the Phantom Frappuccino to celebrate the spooky season. USA TODAY

Chipotle Mexican Grill's Halloween tradition Boorito returns Thursday.

From 3 p.m. to close at all restaurants nationwide, costume-wearing fans can score a $4 burrito, bowl, salad or tacos for the Halloween meal deal.

“It’s always a fun time, and it’s an institution here at Chipotle,” Chris Brandt, the fast-casual chain's chief marketing officer, told USA TODAY.

The promotion is only for in-restaurant orders; online, mobile and delivery orders are excluded. There's a limit of one Boorito per person and, according to the fine print, "determination of whether a ‘costume’ qualifies for the offer is at the sole discretion of Chipotle restaurant personnel."

Pre-Halloween freebie: Taco Bell giving away free tacos Wednesday thanks to World Series stolen base

Halloween 2019: Where to get free food, deals and spooky specials Thursday

Chipotle's Halloween tradition Boorito is back. (Photo: Chipotle Mexican Grill)

Members of Chipotle Rewards – the chain's loyalty program that launched in March –can earn rewards points on their purchases Thursday, Brandt said. New members will get a free order of chips and guacamole after their first purchase of $5 or more. Sign up at www.chipotle.com/rewards.

This year, Chipotle also has a TikTok #Boorito Transformation contest where five winners will get free burritos for a year or one free meal every week for 52 weeks.

TikTok users can participate by posting a TikTok video featuring "their festive before and after Halloween transformations," Chipotle said in a statement. Users will need to include the hashtags #Boorito and #Contest and enter by 1 a.m. EDT on Friday.

The five submissions that receive the most likes will win the grand prize.

Learn more about Boorito and the contest at www.chipotle.com/halloween.
